title: Ownership Structure of General Electric Co Stock

content.text:
As of the most recent filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, institutional investors hold a significant portion of General Electric Co's stock. The top institutional shareholders include:
1. Vanguard Group Inc, with approximately X% ownership
2. BlackRock Inc, with approximately X% ownership
3. State Street Corporation, with approximately X% ownership
4. Fidelity Management & Research Company LLC, with approximately X% ownership
(These ownership percentages are based on the latest available data and may vary over time.)

Insider ownership refers to shares held by individuals who are directly related to the company, such as executives, directors, or employees. As of the most recent filing, insiders hold a notable portion of General Electric Co stock. Notable insider shareholders include:
1. Chairman and CEO, Larry Culp, with approximately X% ownership
2. Vice Chairman and CFO, Carolina Dybeck Happe, with approximately X% ownership
3. Other executives and members of the board of directors also hold significant stakes in the company.
(Ownership percentages of insiders may change as stock transactions occur.)

In addition to institutional investors and insiders, there are several major shareholders who have substantial stakes in General Electric Co. Some of the major shareholders are:
1. Berkshire Hathaway Inc, with approximately X% ownership
2. The Vanguard Group, with approximately X% ownership
3. BlackRock Inc, with approximately X% ownership
4. Trian Fund Management LP, with approximately X% ownership
(Please note that the ownership percentages mentioned are based on available data and could change over time.)

news.headline: UPDATE 1-Short-seller Jim Chanos to close hedge funds -WSJ
news.summary: After nearly four decades, Jim Chanos is shutting down hedge funds he manages that wager against companies he believes are overpriced or fraudulent, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.  Chanos expects to return most of his investors' cash by Dec. 31, it said.  "It is no secret that the long/short equity business model has come under pressure and interest in fundamental stock pickers has waned," Chanos wrote in a letter sent to investors and obtained by Bloomberg News.

news.headline: These 3 Magnificent Stocks Keep Driving Higher
news.summary: Three great stocks that exemplify these particular lessons are Ferrari (NYSE: RACE), with its 64% gain over the past year, Transocean (NYSE: RIG) and its 49% jump, and General Electric's (NYSE: GE) 72% rise.  One of the top-performing auto companies in the world over the past year is Ferrari, and it's not because the company is transitioning to electric vehicles (EVs) or adding products in new markets.  You can see below that Ferrari's operating margin is second to none in the auto industry and they're not declining like some competitors.

news.headline: GE Names New Boards for Its 2 Spinoffs. Here’s Who Is on Them.
news.summary: The iconic American industrial conglomerate  General Electric  is breaking apart.  On Tuesday, GE (ticker: GE) announced the boards of directors for GE’s power-generation business, called GE Vernova, and GE’s aviation business, dubbed GE Aerospace.  GE Vernova is due to be spun out in the second quarter of 2024.
